translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders
The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules🔽The sub-chapter on sandals
1. The training rule on with the head covered

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū oguṇṭhitasīsassa dhammaṁ desenti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū oguṇṭhita sīsassa dhammaṃ desenti pe
translated: the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people with their heads covered. …

original: “Na oguṇṭhitasīsassa agilānassa dhammaṁ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
analyzed: na oguṇṭhita sīsassa a gilānassa dhammam desessāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone with their head covered who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
with a head covering is what is meant.

analyzed: na oguṇṭhita sīsassa a gilānassa dhammaḥ desetabbo
translated: One should not give a teaching to anyone with their head covered who is not sick.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca oguṇṭhitasīsassa agilānassa dhammaṁ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca oguṇṭhita sīsassa a gilānassa dhammam deseti āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone with their head covered who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
if it is unintentional;🔽if he is not thinking;
if he gives a teaching to someone who has uncovered their head;
if he is the first offender.🔽The seventh training rule is finished.
